meaning: Respect authority and those who delegate the task.

proverb: Ẹní tí ó bá ran ni ní iṣẹ́ ni a í bẹ̀rù, a kì í bẹ̀rù ẹni tí a rán ni sí.
translation: We should fear him who sends us with a message, not him to whom we are sent.
meaning: Respect authority and those who delegate the task, not the subordinates you encounter.

proverb: Àgbà kì í wà lóko, kí ọmọdé ó wá a nílé.
translation: An elder does not stay on the farm and let a child search for him at home.
meaning: The leader must be present where their duty is.

proverb: Tí a bá fẹ́ kọ́ ilé, a gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́ òpó.
translation: If you want to build a house, you must build the pillars.
meaning: A strong foundation is essential for any major endeavor.

proverb: Kò sí orúkọ tí kò ní ìdí.
translation: There is no name without a reason.
meaning: Everything happens for a purpose; every action has a root cause.

proverb: Ewé gbígbẹ ní a ti ń sán ní òwúrọ̀ kùtù.
translation: Dry palm leaves must be tied early in the morning.
meaning: Make hay while the sun shines; do the necessary work early.

proverb: Bí a bá ròkè, ilẹ̀ la ó padà bọ̀.
translation: Whatever goes up must come down.
meaning: Be humble, as positions of power and influence are temporary.

proverb: Ẹni tó fi abọ́ jẹun, kò ní àyè fún ìbá.
translation: The one who eats with a plate has no space for a calabash.
meaning: Prioritize needs and avoid excessive consumption or greed.

proverb: Àgbà kì í wà nílé, kí ọ̀rọ̀ ó bàjẹ́.
translation: An elder does not stay at home and allow things to spoil.
meaning: Elders are responsible for maintaining peace and order.

proverb: Àgbọ́kọ́kó ni àbùkù.
translation: The first listening is the source of the trouble.
meaning: Listen carefully at the beginning to avoid misunderstanding and problems.

proverb: A kì í fi owó kan ra ọ̀pọ̀lọ́.
translation: One does not use one coin to buy a toad (a bad bargain).
meaning: Be cautious about cheap offers, as they often come with hidden costs or problems.

proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó bá ti inú ìyàwó jáde, kò ní pa olùgbọ́.
translation: A word that comes out of a wife's mouth will not kill the listener.
meaning: Pay attention to advice from unexpected or humble sources.

proverb: Bí a bá fẹ́ lọ ibi tí òjò rọ̀, a gbọ́dọ̀ mú àgùbànyẹ̀ rà.
translation: If you want to go where it rained, you must take a goat's leather.
meaning: Prepare adequately for the conditions of your destination.

proverb: Eni tí kò bá fọwọ́ sí àwọn ẹranko burúkú, kì í jẹ́ ẹran wọn.
translation: He who is not involved in wicked animal sacrifices will not eat their meat.
meaning: Avoid associating with bad deeds to avoid their negative consequences.

proverb: Eni tí ó rẹ́ni lẹ́mìí, kò gbọ́dọ̀ wá ilé.
translation: The person who saves another's life must not seek recompense.
meaning: True benevolence should not seek a reward.

proverb: Àgbà kì í fìyà jẹ́ ọmọdé láìnídìí.
translation: An elder does not punish a child without a reason.
meaning: Authority figures should act with justice and justification.

proverb: Bí omi kò bá wà, ẹja kò ní rọra.
translation: If there is no water, the fish will not be at ease.
meaning: Lack of necessities causes great discomfort and danger.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ ìwà rere, yóò rí èrè rẹ̀.
translation: He who loves good behavior will see its reward.
meaning: Virtuous actions are always beneficial in the long run.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá fẹ́ jẹ àjẹkù, kò gbọ́dọ̀ gbéra.
translation: He who wants to eat leftovers must not be proud.
meaning: Humility is required to receive help or benefit from others.

proverb: A kì í fi ìjà kọlé.
translation: One does not use fighting to build a house.
meaning: Peace and cooperation are essential for constructive endeavors.

proverb: Bí omi bá ti ń rọ́, tó ń rọ́, yóò wá sí ìsàlẹ̀.
translation: However much the water pours, it must eventually come down.
meaning: Everything has its limit; excessiveness will eventually be corrected.

proverb: Òjò méjì kò ní jọ́ kan.
translation: Two rainy seasons will not be in one day.
meaning: Be patient; every event has its appointed time.

proverb: Kò sí ohun tí a kò lè fi sọ́kàn.
translation: There is nothing that we cannot commit to memory.
meaning: The human mind is capable of vast learning.

proverb: A kì í fi ọmọdé sílé, kí a lọ ṣègbéyàwó.
translation: One does not leave a child at home to go and marry.
meaning: Address current, core responsibilities before pursuing new ventures.

proverb: Ẹni tí a bá rí, ni a lè dá lẹ́jọ́.
translation: The one we see is the one we can accuse.
meaning: The visible person is often the one blamed; proof is necessary for justice.

proverb: Àgbà tó jẹ́ wọ́n, á fi èpò sọ́kàn.
translation: An elder who eats alone will keep the crumbs in his mind.
meaning: Sharing brings blessings; being selfish brings worry.

proverb: Ẹni tí kò bá gbọ́rọ̀ lẹ́nu, yóò rí ìbàjẹ́.
translation: He who does not listen to advice will suffer ruin.
meaning: Heed the words of the wise.

proverb: Gbogbo ewé ní ń dá èjìká, kò sí èyí tí kò lè dá èjìká.
translation: All leaves rest on the shoulder; there is none that cannot rest on the shoulder.
meaning: Every burden can be carried with perseverance.

proverb: Àgbọ́kọ́kó ní ń fẹ́ kí ó dágbà kí ó wá rí nkan tí ó fẹ́.
translation: The one who listened early will grow up to get what he wants.
meaning: Early preparedness and wisdom pay off later in life.

proverb: Bí a bá fẹ́ gòkè, a gbọ́dọ̀ kọ́ òkè.
translation: If you want to climb up, you must first construct a ladder.
meaning: Preparation and method are essential for advancement.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá fẹ́ ṣeré pẹ̀lú ọmọdé, yóò rí ọmọdé nínú rẹ̀.
translation: He who wants to play with a child will find the child in him.
meaning: Lower your standards to deal with immature people.

proverb: Kò sí ọ̀rọ̀ tí kò ní ìdí.
translation: There is no issue without a source.
meaning: Everything has a root cause that must be investigated.

proverb: Àgbẹ̀ tí ó bá fẹ́ kórè, kò gbọ́dọ̀ yé gbìn.
translation: A farmer who wants to harvest must not stop planting.
meaning: Continuous effort is necessary to achieve results.

proverb: Bí a bá ń bọ́ra, a kì í ṣeré pẹ̀lú ọbẹ̀.
translation: When one is bathing, one does not play with the soup.
meaning: Focus on the main task at hand; don't mix serious work with distractions.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá nífẹ̀ẹ́ ìjà, yóò rí ìjà.
translation: He who loves a fight will find a fight.
meaning: What you seek, you will find (often used negatively).

proverb: A kì í fi ọwọ́ kan gbá ilé.
translation: One does not sweep the house with one hand.
meaning: Teamwork and collaboration are necessary for difficult tasks.

proverb: Bí a bá ń wọlé ọba, a gbọ́dọ̀ tẹrí ba.
translation: When entering the king's palace, you must bow your head.
meaning: Show respect to authority and powerful figures.

proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ àgbà kì í ṣubú.
translation: The word of an elder does not fall (is never false).
meaning: The advice of elders is wise and should be trusted.

proverb: Bí a bá rìn jìnnà, a ó ríran.
translation: If one travels far, one will see more.
meaning: Experience and exploration lead to greater wisdom.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá jẹ́ ká mọ̀ pé òun ni, òun ni.
translation: He who allows us to know that he is the one, he is the one.
meaning: Acknowledge and respect the obvious source of power or authority.

proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí a kò lè fi sọ́kàn.
translation: There is no one that we cannot keep in mind.
meaning: Never forget the people who are important to you.

proverb: Tí a bá ń gbá ilé, a kì í gbá ẹnu ọ̀nà.
translation: When sweeping the house, one does not sweep the doorway.
meaning: Protect the entrance of your life/home from external troubles.

proverb: A kì í fi orí jẹ bírí.
translation: One does not use the head to eat bírí (a large chunk of food).
meaning: Do not rush into major decisions; think before you act.

proverb: Bí iná bá jó, kò sí èyí tí kò ní jó.
translation: If fire burns, there is nothing it will not burn.
meaning: A general problem affects everyone; no one is truly safe.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá fẹ́ gòkè, yóò kọ́ ìrèké.
translation: He who wants to climb up will first cut sugarcane.
meaning: Even for ambitious goals, humble preparations are necessary.

proverb: A kì í fi èérú bọ́ lára.
translation: One does not take off dirt to put on ashes.
meaning: Do not replace one bad situation with an equally bad or worse one.

proverb: Kò sí ẹni tí a kò lè fi sọ́kàn.
translation: There is no one that we cannot keep in mind.
meaning: Never forget the people who are important to you.

proverb: Bí a bá ń fẹ́ràn ọmọdé, a kì í fi ìjà kọ́ọ.
translation: If you love a child, you don't teach them by fighting.
meaning: Discipline with love and wisdom, not aggression.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá fẹ́ ṣeré pẹ̀lú ẹkùn, yóò rí ẹkùn nínú rẹ̀.
translation: He who wants to play with a leopard will find the leopard in him.
meaning: Be careful when dealing with dangerous people; you may become like them.

proverb: A kì í fi ọwọ́ kan pa eku.
translation: One does not use one hand to kill a rat.
meaning: Complex problems require thorough effort and preparation.

proverb: Ọ̀rọ̀ àgbà kì í ṣubú.
translation: The word of an elder does not fall (is never false).
meaning: Trust the advice of the wise.

proverb: Bí a bá ń yọ̀, a kì í gbàgbé ìbá.
translation: When one is rejoicing, one does not forget the struggle.
meaning: Remember past hardships during times of success.

proverb: Ẹni tí ó bá fẹ́ gbọ́, yóò gbọ́.
translation: He who wants to hear will hear.
meaning: A determined listener will always find a way to learn.

proverb: Àgbà kì í wà nílé, kí ọmọdé ó bàjẹ́.
translation: An elder does not stay at home and let a child be ruined.
meaning: Elders have a responsibility to guide and correct the youth.

proverb: Bí a bá ń fẹ́ràn ọmọdé, a kì í fi ìjà kọ́ọ.

translation: An elder does not stay at home and let a child be ruined.
meaning: Elders have a responsibility to guide and correct the youth.

proverb: Otu osisi anaghị eme oke ọhịa.
translation: One tree does not make a forest.
meaning: Great achievements require collective effort and unity.

proverb: Anya na-acha uhie uhie anaghị aṅụ mmanya ọcha.
translation: A red eye does not drink palm wine.
meaning: A person who is angry or ill-tempered cannot enjoy peace or pleasure.

proverb: Onye gburu nwa, chi ya egbughị ya.
translation: A person who kills a child is not killed by their destiny (Chi).
meaning: Some evils are self-inflicted and defy fate; you face the consequences of your deliberate, wicked actions.

proverb: Mberede ka eji ama dike.
translation: Difficulties are what make a hero known.
meaning: True strength and character are revealed in a crisis.

proverb: Onye ji onye n'ala, ji onwe ya.
translation: He who holds another person to the ground also holds himself down.
meaning: Holding a grudge or oppressing others limits your own progress.

proverb: Nwata kwochaa aka, ya soro ndị okenye rie nri.
translation: When a child washes his hands clean, he can eat with the elders.
meaning: Preparation and proving oneself earn you a seat at the table with those who are respected.

proverb: Ijele anaghị akwụrụ n’otu ebe ana-ele ya.
translation: The grand masquerade (Ijele) is not viewed from a single spot.
meaning: You need to look at life's complexities from many perspectives.

proverb: Anaghị eji na agụụ na-agụ noo ụkwara.
translation: You do not swallow phlegm to appease the pangs of hunger.
meaning: Don't accept a poor substitute for what you truly need.

proverb: Ugo chara acha adịghị achụ àchụ.
translation: A mature eagle's feather will always remain pure.
meaning: A person of good character will always stand the test of time.

proverb: Ife onye metara, ọ bụrụ.
translation: What a person does, they carry (the consequence).
meaning: You are responsible for the results of your actions.

proverb: Mgbe onye ji teta ụra bụ ụtụtụ ya.
translation: Whenever one wakes up from sleep is their own morning.
meaning: It is never too late to start doing what is right or to pursue a goal.

proverb: Ekele dike na nke o mere, o mekwa ọzọ.
translation: When the mighty is praised for what they have done, they will do more.
meaning: Appreciation encourages better performance and effort.

proverb: Agwọ emeghi nke o jiri bụrụ agwọ, ụmụaka achịrị ya hie nkụ.
translation: If a snake fails to show its venom, little kids will use it in tying firewood.
meaning: You must assert your identity and capabilities, or people will disrespect you.

proverb: Aka aja aja n'ebute ọnụ mmanu mmanu.
translation: The hand that has known much toiling will eventually know much feasting.
meaning: Hard work and diligence eventually lead to prosperity.

proverb: Ụkpana okpoko gburu ntị chiri ya.
translation: The grasshopper that is killed by a Crow is deaf.
meaning: Once forewarned of danger, flee, unless one is deaf (or unwilling to listen).

proverb: Akụ na-esi obi ike.
translation: Wealth makes the heart strong.
meaning: Financial security gives one courage and boldness.

proverb: Ihe e zutere n'ohi na-ala n'ohi.
translation: Whatever one obtains by crooked means leaves one's possession by crooked means.
meaning: Ill-gotten gains do not last; stolen wealth is volatile.

proverb: Ndidi nwe mmeri.
translation: Patience owns the victory.
meaning: Success is achieved through perseverance and waiting for the right moment.

proverb: Onye kwe, Chi ya ekwe.
translation: When a person says yes, their Chi (personal god) says yes.
meaning: Man's determination is the key to activating his destiny.

proverb: Nwata etoghi eto wara ọgọdọ, ikuku kụọ, ọ bulu ya na ọgọdọ ọ ma n'ụkwụ.
translation: If a child tries to tie a wrapper before maturity, when the wind blows, it will carry both the child and the wrapper.
meaning: Do not rush into responsibilities or status for which you are not yet prepared.

proverb: Ọ na-abụ akọta ihe ka ubi, e lee ọba.
translation: While farming, if one encounters what is more significant than the farm, one sells the barn.
meaning: One who incurs what is beyond one's ability may sell all one has; know your limits.

proverb: Egbe bere, Ụgọ bere, nke sị ibe ya ebena nku kwaa ya.
translation: Let the eagle perch, let the kite perch; if one doesn't want the other to perch, may his wings break.
meaning: Live and let live; mutual respect is necessary for coexistence.

proverb: Akụrụ ụlọ amara onye kpatara ya.
translation: When wealth reaches home, the wealthy person will be known.
meaning: The successful person's efforts will eventually be recognized.

proverb: Ụwa bụ ahịa, onye zụsia ọ nakwụrụ Chi.
translation: The cosmos is a grand market; after trading, one returns to god.
meaning: Life is a temporary journey; one's ultimate fate is in the hands of the creator.

proverb: Oji nwayọọ anaghị emerụ ahụ.
translation: The one who takes it easy will hardly get hurt.
meaning: Prudence and caution minimize risk and injury.

proverb: Onye n'akwa nka na-adụ ihu.
translation: The artist/craft-adept often appears to wear a frown in the process of their work.
meaning: Deep concentration and focused effort may look like distress to an outsider.

proverb: Ife onye metara, ọ bụrụ.
translation: Whatsoever one's actions are, they must be prepared to face the consequences.
meaning: You are responsible for your own destiny; karma is real.

proverb: Ọkụkọ na-abọpụta mma na-egbu ya.
translation: The fowl digs out the blade that kills it.
meaning: Some people unknowingly bring about their own downfall.

proverb: A chụọ aja ma ahụghị ụdèlè, mara na ihe mere na be ndị mmụọ.
translation: If the vulture fails to hover at the end of a sacrifice, then you know that something has happened in the land of spirits.
meaning: If expected consequences or signs fail to appear, there is a serious, underlying cause.

proverb: Nwa bụrụ osisi, e be ya ọzọ; nwa bụrụ mmadụ, e nye ya aka.
translation: If a child is a tree, it is cut again; if a child is a person, one gives him a hand.
meaning: A person should be corrected and guided, not destroyed by their mistakes.

proverb: Onye bulu ihe isi, ijiji esoro ya.
translation: The fly follows the person who is carrying a smelly stuff.
meaning: Trouble and unwelcome attention follow those associated with bad business or bad reputation.

proverb: Aka nri kwọọ aka ekpe, aka ekpe akwọọ aka nri.
translation: When the right hand washes the left hand, the left hand equally washes the right hand.
meaning: Reciprocity and mutual support are essential in any relationship.

proverb: Ije na ụra na-agba aka.
translation: Journey and sleep go hand in hand.
meaning: Rest is necessary after a period of intense effort or travel.

proverb: Nwata akpọọ ọkụ ọkụ, ọ tụọ ụjọ.
translation: If a child calls fire, fire, it becomes afraid.
meaning: Naming a problem is the first step, but fear can prevent you from facing it.

proverb: Ukpala gbabara n'ikpo ọkụkọ na-ala ala mmụọ.
translation: The grasshopper that runs into the mist of fowls ends up in the land of spirits.
meaning: Do not seek refuge among your enemies; choose your allies carefully.
